column1: Flora Lee's birthday came in July. Her mother wished very much to celebrate the occasion in a proper manner. Flora was a good girl
column2: and her parents were always glad to do any thing they could to please her
column3: and to increase her happiness.They were very indulgent parents
column4: and as they had plenty of money
column5: they could afford to pay well for a "good time." Yet they were not weak and silly in their indulgence. As much as they loved their little daughter
column6: they did not give her pies and cakes to eat when they thought such articles would hurt her.They did not let her lie in bed till noon because they loved her
column7: or permit her to do any thing that would injure her
column8: either in body or mind. Flora always went to church
column10: and never cried to stay at home. If she had cried
column11: it would have made no difference
column12: for her father and mother meant to have her do right
column13: whether she liked it or not.
